alert.note: Alert for Austin; Brazos; Burleson; Colorado; Washington (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 16 at 1:59PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN COLORADO... NORTHWESTERN AUSTIN...BURLESON...CENTRAL BRAZOS AND WASHINGTON COUNTIES THROUGH 245 PM CDT... At 159 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles north of Caldwell to 7 miles northwest of Somerville to near Burton to 6 miles west of Round Top to near Muldoon to Waelder. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... College Station, Bryan, Brenham, Caldwell, Shelby, Weimar, Somerville, Snook, Industry, Burton, Millican, Lake Somerville Dam, Kyle Field, Bryan Utilities Lake, Lake Somerville State Park & Trailway, Carmine, Lyons, Deanville, Independence, and New Ulm. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
